results.title: Angele
results.brief_description:
Seduced and abandoned, Angele, a young naive peasant girl goes to Marseilles where she prostitutes herself in order to support her child. Angele’s father fetches her back to the farm, forcibly locking the girl and her newborn baby in his cellar. In Pagnol’s more Gionoesque works, a major theme is the Land and its relationship to Woman: both can be barren or fertile, unforgiving or kind, depending on circumstance and how one treats them. The earth’s fertility is often symbolised by spring water and traditionally baked bread; their absence indicates a world out of joint. Pagnol liked to celebrate the testing and renewal of human bonds; along with Jacques Feyder but in an entirely different, affirmative register, he is one of the French cinema’s great observer of the family.” Reference: Alan Williams. “Republic of Images: a history of French filmmaking”. Harvard University Press, 1992. ‘Angele’ was the first French film shot entirely on location with direct sound recording. It was hailed by Vittorio De Sica as an example for the Italian Neo-Realist School. See also: ‘La femme du boulanger’ directed by Marcel Pagnol (X000449).

Credits: Director, Marcel Pagnol ; writer, Marcel pagnol ; photography, Willy [Faktorovitch], Roger Ledru ; music, Vincent Scotto ; editor, Suzanne de Troeye ; art direction, Marius Brouquier.
Cast: Henri Poupon, Annie Toinon, Orane Demazis, Fernandel, Edouart Delmont, Jean Servais, Andrex, Charles Blavette, Blanche Poupon, Darcelys.

results.title: An Interview with Pat Vines: The Shrine of Remembrance
results.creator_credit: Pat Vines and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: After Pat Vines returns from the war as a Commander of the Australian Navy, one of her senior navy officers recommends her to the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees, which she joins. She tells of her time as a Trustee for the Shrine.

results.title: Angela's ashes [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, Scott Rudin, David Brown and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: After immigrating to America, young Frank and his family move back to Limerick following the death of his infant sister. The family is forced to live in the slums of Ireland, with conditions being much worse than they were in America. His Northern Irish father, Malachy, has difficulty finding work because of his former loyalty to the IRA, and what little money he earns, he drinks away, leaving Frank, his mother Angela, and his young brother to scrounge for coal and beg for food and clothing. Determined to escape the poverty, illness, and death that surrounds him in Ireland, Frank dreams of returning to America. Cast includes Emily Watson and Robert Carlyle. Based on the Pulitzer Prize winning autobiography by Frank McCourt.

results.title: Anchors aweigh
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: There are many moments of stunning virtuosity in George Sidney’s exuberant musical entertainment “Anchors Aweigh”. One of the most wonderful of all MGM’s musicals, it is set in Los Angeles and Hollywood. Isobel Lennart’s witty screenplay is about two sailors on leave - Gene Kelly and Frank Sinatra - and their involvement with a Hollywood extra - Kathryn Grayson - whom they want to help become a musical star. The songs include “All of a Sudden my Heart Sings”, “Jealousy”, “All of a Sudden my Heart Sings”, “I Fall in Love too Easily” and “What Makes the Sunset”. Rated: G

results.title: An Interview with Jock McAuley
results.creator_credit: Jock McAuley and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Jock McAuley remembers hearing Prime Minister Menzies announcing Australia was at war. He was only 15 or 16 at the time and wondered if the would be still going by the time he was old enough to join. Against his dad’s wishes, Jock joined up and served as a pilot during the war. He tells of his experiences fighting for Australia.

results.title: Angel in the house
results.creator_credit: Jane Jackson and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: The film takes as its theme an essay by Virginia Woolf written in 1927. In the essay Virginia Woolf talks about women writers and the psychological and social barriers to their creativity and their self-confidence. In 1977, the film’s protagonist Lily Ramsey is an aspiring writer, and an admirer of Virginia Woolf. In an attempt to complete her first novel, she takes a break from her job in London and goes home to the small seaside town where her family still lives. However, for Lily home is not simply a peaceful place to write, but part of the experience which she brings to bear on her writing.

results.title: Anatomy of Hell = Anatomie de L'Enfer [DVD] (E)
results.creator_credit: Catherine Breillat, Jean-Francois Lepetit, CB Films (France) and Flach Film
results.brief_description: A woman at a nightclub is rejected by her gay, male lover, becomes suicidal and goes to the toilets to cut her wrists. She is prevented from further harm by the kindness of another gay man (played by Italian porn star Rocco Stiffredi) who follows her. Their conversation leads the woman to set up a challenge or deal, that she will pay this man and he is to listen and learn about how men see women’s bodies. Over the next four nights the two engage in the most intimate acts and conversations in trying to work out the male/female sexual dynamic. From the controversial director of 1999’s “Romance” Catherine Breillat wants to shock with close-ups of genitals and discussions of menstruation that are sure to affect some viewers. Almost banned from release in Australia. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: An Interview with Allan Couper
results.creator_credit: Allan Couper and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Allan Couper is a Victorian World War II veteran. He served as a pilot in Europe as part of the Bomber Squadron. As part of the Digital Storytelling project “In our words”, Allan relates his experiences of fighting in Europe during the war.

results.title: Angel baby
results.creator_credit: Michael Rymer, Timothy White, Jonathan Shteinman, Stamen and Meridian Films
results.brief_description: A funny, haunting love story, this film tells the story of two lost souls, Harry and Kate who fall in love against the odds and find the hope and strength in each other to accomplish the impossible. Jacqueline McKenzie and John Lynch star as two people with psychological problems who must also overcome many obstacles on the path to happiness, not the least of which is the pre-conceived notions of other people. Full of humour, compassion and hope this is a testament to the power of love; a roller coaster journey to the magical fringes of the human psyche.

results.title: Anatomy of a murder
results.brief_description: A riveting courtroom drama of rape and premeditated murder is brought to life with an all-star cast in Otto Preminger’s suspenseful and highly acclaimed production. Packed with drama, passion and intrigue, the film pits humble small-town lawyer, Jimmy Stewart against hard-headed city prosecutor, George C. Scott. Emotions flare as jealous army lieutenant, Ben Gazzara pleads innocent to murdering the rapist of his seductive, beautiful wife, Lee Remick. Honoured with seven Academy Award nominations and featuring a brilliant score by Duke Ellington, this film is a masterpiece that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Based on the novel by Robert Traver.
